channel.title: ICERM Generative Models Discussion Group
channel.description: Recent content on ICERM Generative Models Discussion Group

item.title: Papers
item.description: Papers Here is a list of suggested papers, loosely organized by topic. Compositional Generative Models Lake, Brenden M., Ruslan Salakhutdinov, and Joshua B. Tenenbaum. 2015. “Human-Level Concept Learning through Probabilistic Program Induction.” Science 350 (6266): 1332–38. link George, D., W. Lehrach, K. Kansky, M. Lázaro-Gredilla, C. Laan, B. Marthi, X. Lou, et al. 2017. “A Generative Vision Model That Trains with High Data Efficiency and Breaks Text-Based CAPTCHAs.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Upcoming Schedule Overview of Deep Generative Models and Discussion When: Tuesday 2019-03-05 10 am to 11 am Where: ICERM 11th Floor Lecture Hall Presenter: Guangyao Zhou Scribe: Guangyao Zhou Flow-based Generative Models and Discussion When: Thursday 2019-03-14 10 am to 11 am Where: ICERM 11th Floor Lecture Hall Presenter: Shubhendu Trivedi Scribe: Shubhendu Trivedi Past Schedule Tutorial on Probabilistic Programming When: Thursday 2019-02-28 10 am to 11 am Where: ICERM 11th Floor Lecture Hall

item.title: About
item.description: The ICERM Generative Models Discussion Group is part of the Semester Program in Computer Vision at ICERM. We meet in most weeks in the Spring 2019 semester in the 11th floor lecture hall at ICERM. The discussion group will focus on the general research area of probabilistic generative models. For questions, please contact Guangyao Zhou.

item.title: Tutorial on Probabilistic Programming
item.description: On Thursday 2019-02-28 from 10 am to 11 am, Prof. Daniel Ritchie gave a tutorial on probabilistic programming in the 11th floor lecture hall at ICERM. The slides are available online. A blog post with a summary would be available later.
